title: Spezi007
author: Spezi007
content: hellotoday i install my apollo full node and a standard apolloOn first launch everything worked fine and I can log into the dashboard...then I updated the dashboard to 0.3.4then i clicked through the dashboard and saw that the node was not started. I tried to start it and waited 5-15 minutes.. nothing happened..then i wanted to check the m.2 card and shut down the apollo in the dashboard.. m.2 was ok...so everything was switched on again...since then it can no longer be found in the network...red led lights up and fan is offI then connected an HDMI monitor and a mouse but the monitor gets no signalis there a power button somewhere?what are those mini buttons on the board?thanks for any help

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Since you disconnected the m.2 recently then there is a possibility that you inserted the m.2 drive incorrectly.You can try these steps: - unplug the m.2 drive again and insert it back to the unit.- If it didn't work unplug it again and check the terminals and maybe there are some dirt and rust clean it using a pencil eraser or isopropyl alcohol then replug it again and test.
